content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.92 - Executive Order No. 92: Establishing the New York State Office of Development Planning

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, by virtue of the authority vested in me
by the Constitution and the laws of the State of New York, and as Governor of
the State of New York, by Executive Order do hereby establish in the Executive

Department, Office of the Governor, an Office to be known as the New York State

Office of Development Planning to coordinate planning and development
activities of State agencies, and to insure greater consistency between and
among functional development planning efforts and Administration policy. General Powers and Duties

It is the policy of the State in meeting public needs to
establish coordinated and consistent planning and development programs, policies and priorities to achieve sound and balanced growth and development, the effective and efficient use of the State's resources and a strengthened

State economy. To assist in carrying out the foregoing policy, the New

York State Office of Development Planning shall: - Identify and analyze for the Governor the major
development factors affecting the State's future. - Assist in the formulation of coordinated State policies, plans and programs addressing these major factors, as they affect the State's
development. - Undertake, as the Governor may direct, any studies, research, inquiries or analyses necessary for the development, coordination or
implementation of State policies, plans and programs. - Promote the efficient utilization of the State's
resources, through coordination of State agency plans/and programs, and the
direction of interagency planning and development. - Support coordination of the sub-cabinet structure with
agency policy planning functions. - Coordinate State policies related to Federal and
interstate/multistate planning and development issues, intitiatives, legislation and organizations. - Review and undertake policy analysis of federal
legislation related to the development potential of the State. - Act as the State's economic development planning agency
pursuant to Public Law
89-136
(Public Works and Economic Development Act of
1965), together with any act or acts amendatory or supplemental thereto, and
any regulations promulgated thereunder, and to do all things necessary or
convenient to fulfill the purposes and requirements of such act or acts
including receiving and disbursing funds made available under such act or
acts. - Participate in other federal planning programs, as the

Governor may direct. Amendment of Prior Order, Effective Date and

Transfer Provisions

Executive Order Number 73, dated July 12, 1978
reestablishing the New York State Economic Development Board and transferring
certain functions, powers, duties and obligations formerly possessed by such

Board to the New York State Department of Commerce is hereby amended; and, effective immediately, all of the functions, powers, duties and obligations
transferred to the New York State Department of Commerce by such Executive

Order relating to the duties of the New York State Department of Commerce to
oversee and coordinate economic development planning activities in the State
and to act as the State's economic development planning agency pursuant to

Public Law
89-136
(Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965, as
amended), and all duties incidental thereto, shall be transferred and assigned
to, assumed and devolved upon the New York State Office of Development

Planning; and all of the rights and obligations of the New York State

Department of Commerce under any contract or agreement relating to such
functions, powers, duties and obligations to which the New York State

Department of Commerce is a party, are hereby transferred, and assigned to, devolved upon and assumed by the New York State Office of Development

Planning. With respect to the functions, powers, duties and
obligations so transferred and assumed, the New York State Office of

Development Planning shall be deemed and be held to constitute the continuation
of the New York State Department of Commerce for those purposes and not a
different board, agency or authority. Any proceeding or other business or
matter heretofore undertaken or commenced by or before the New York State

Department of Commerce relative to the functions, powers, duties and
obligations herein transferred to and assumed by the New York State Office of

Development Planning may be conducted and completed by the New York State

Office of Development Planning in the same manner and under the same conditions
and with the same effect as if conducted and completed by the New York State

Department of Commerce. All Federal funds available to the New York State

Department of Commerce for the performance of the functions, powers, duties and
obligations transferred and assigned to the New York State Office of

Development Planning pursuant to this Executive Order, to the extent remaining
unexpended or unencumbered, shall be transferred to and made available for use
by the New York State Office of Development Planning for the same purposes for
which originally provided. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: August 21, 1979
